text: Mack Sennett (born Michael Sinnott; January 17, 1880 â€“ November 5, 1960) was a Canadian-American actor, director, and comedian. He was known as the "King of Comedy". He helped create the first slapstick silent comedy movies. Sennett died on November 5, 1960, in Woodland Hills, California, aged 80. According to IMDB he acted in 360 films. == Biography == Michael Sinnott was born in Richmond, Quebec in the Irish Catholi family. When he was 17 years old he moved to Connecticut. ==References== Category:1880 births Category:1960 deaths Category:American silent movie actors Category:Canadian movie actors Category:Canadian movie directors Category:Canadian movie producers Category:Canadian stage actors Category:American stage actors Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Movie producers from Los Angeles Category:Movie directors from Los Angeles Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:Actors from Quebec Category:Screenwriters from Los Angeles Category:Canadian screenwriters Category:Writers from Quebec Category:American composers Category:Canadian composers Category:American cinematographers
title: Mack Sennett
